# Rahul Vishwakarma - Complete Knowledge Base

> Chief Technology Officer at WorkOnward | IEEE Senior Member | BCS Fellow | 60+ U.S. Patents | Machine Learning Expert | Generative AI Specialist

================================================================================
## PROFESSIONAL SUMMARY
================================================================================

Rahul Vishwakarma (BCS Fellow, IEEE Senior Member) is a distinguished technology leader and innovator with deep expertise in machine learning, deep learning, generative AI, and agentic AI systems. He currently serves as Chief Technology Officer at WorkOnward, where he architects scalable solutions for enterprise applications.

With over 60 granted U.S. patents in artificial intelligence, machine learning, and enterprise data storage, Rahul stands among the top 0.54% of inventors with 50-99 granted patents. His patents cover diverse applications including machine learning techniques in data analysis, smart data management, hardware health monitoring, anomaly detection, and system upgrade management.

================================================================================
## CURRENT POSITION
================================================================================

**Chief Technology Officer (CTO)**
WorkOnward | https://www.workonward.com
- Leading technology strategy and innovation for AI-powered recruitment platforms
- Developing agentic AI systems for enterprise HR technology applications
- Building next-generation Agent-to-Agent (A2A) communication protocols
- Architecting scalable cloud infrastructure for enterprise solutions

================================================================================
## EDUCATION
================================================================================

**Master of Science in Computer Science**
California State University, Long Beach | Graduated May 2024
- Graduate Dean's List (Top 1%)
- Outstanding Graduate Research, Scholarly, and Creative Activity (RSCA) Award
- Student Commencement Speaker, College of Engineering 2024
- Teaching Assistant for AI, ML, and Pattern Recognition courses
- Founded AI Research Club at CSULB (March 2024)

================================================================================
## PATENTS (60+ Granted U.S. Patents)
================================================================================

Rahul holds over 60 granted U.S. patents assigned to EMC IP Holding Company LLC (Dell Technologies). These innovations span:

**Domains:**
- Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
- Enterprise Data Storage and Management
- Cloud Infrastructure and Distributed Systems
- Hardware Health Monitoring and Predictive Maintenance
- Anomaly Detection and Security

**Notable Patent:**
U.S. Patent 11,513,931 - "Anomaly aware log retrieval from disk array enclosures"
- Issued: November 29, 2022
- Successfully implemented in Dell PowerProtect Data Domain

**Full Patent List:**
https://patents.google.com/?inventor=Rahul+Deo+Vishwakarma,Rahul+Vishwakarma&assignee=EMC+IP+Holding+Company+LLC

================================================================================

Published in top-tier venues with rigorous peer review:

**IEEE/ACM Conferences:**
1. "Uncertainty-Aware Hardware Trojan Detection Using Multimodal Deep Learning"
   - Venue: DATE 2024 (Design Automation and Test in Europe)
   - Acceptance Rate: 22%
   - Featured on IEEE TV

2. "Risk-Aware and Explainable Framework for Ensuring Guaranteed Coverage in Evolving Hardware Trojan Detection"
   - Venue: ICCAD 2023 (International Conference on Computer-Aided Design)
   - Acceptance Rate: 23%
   - Featured on IEEE TV

3. "SpeechCraft: An Integrated Data Generation Pipeline from Videos for LLM Finetuning"
   - Venue: ICAC 2024 (International Conference on Automation and Computing)
   - Collaboration with Google and Tubi TV

https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=F2eTslkAAAAJ&hl=en&oi=ao

================================================================================
## BOOK AUTHORSHIP
================================================================================

**"Conformal Prediction for Inventors"**
- Publisher: Available on Amazon
- ISBN: 9334114894
- Link: https://www.amazon.com/dp/9334114894

**About the Book:**
A practical guide demonstrating how to design innovative solutions using conformal prediction in risk-sensitive domains, particularly enterprise data storage. This is the fifth book on Conformal Prediction (as listed on Wikipedia) and approaches the topic from an inventor's perspective rather than academic theory.

**Free Copy:** Available for students with valid .edu email addresses

================================================================================
## SPEAKING ENGAGEMENTS
================================================================================

**IEEE TV Featured Talks:**
- Uncertainty-Aware Hardware Trojan Detection Using Multimodal Deep Learning (DATE 2024)
- Risk-Aware and Explainable Framework for Hardware Trojan Detection (ICCAD 2023)

**SNIA Storage Developer Conference (2019-2024):**
10+ talks delivered at SNIA SDC conferences in USA, EMEA, and India:

1. Understanding the Reliability of Predictions Made by Machine Learning (SNIA India 2019)
2. New Perspective on Machine Learning Predictions Under Uncertainty (SNIA USA 2019)
3. Rethinking Blockchain in Storage (SNIA India 2020)
4. Ranking based Dynamic Hot Sparing (SNIA India 2021)
5. Transforming Monolith to Microservices (SNIA India 2021)
6. Smart Contract for DNA Based Archival Storage (SNIA EMEA 2022)
7. Certainty to Enterprise Disk-Drive Failure Management with Conformal Prediction (SNIA EMEA 2022)
8. Power of Chaos: Long-term Security for Post-quantum Era (SNIA USA 2022)
9. Effective Device Thermal Management Based on Dynamic Ranking (SNIA India 2022)
10. Fortifying AIOps: CSAF and VEX Unite for Smarter Security (SNIA SDC 2024)
11. Design Specification and AI-Driven Digital Twin Architecture for Storage Devices (SNIA SDC 2025)

**IEEE Enterprise GenAI Summit 2025:**
- Talk: "AAA-IDE: Autonomous Agentic AI for Data Engineering"
- Location: San Jose, CA
- Source Code: https://github.com/rahvis/multi-agent-system

## TEACHING EXPERIENCE
================================================================================

**California State University, Long Beach (2022-2023)**
Teaching Assistant and Co-instructor for:

1. **CECS 551 - Advanced Artificial Intelligence** (Graduate, Fall 2023)
   - Advanced concepts: fuzzy logic, Dempster-Shafer theory, neural networks

2. **CECS 550 - Pattern Recognition** (Graduate, Spring 2023)
   - Trainable classifiers, decision theory, neural networks

3. **CECS 456 - Machine Learning** (Undergraduate, Fall 2022 & Spring 2023)
   - Supervised/unsupervised learning, deep learning, neural networks

4. **CECS 451 - Artificial Intelligence** (Undergraduate, Spring 2023)
   - Search, constraint satisfaction, game-playing, logical agents

5. **CECS 229 - Discrete Structures** (Undergraduate, Fall 2022)
   - Computer arithmetic, matrices, Python programming assignments
